now the reason why we are on a river right now is

very functional actually so coconuts are grown in 
between these rivers because a couple of reasons

one the coconuts can naturally just absorb the 
water they don't need to ever water the coconuts

as long as they keep these rivers filled to the 
river prevents the coconut from becoming damaged

when they pick them because the coconuts fall into 
the water and they float no damage there and then

some people also keep fish in these rivers so it's 
an added you know source of food or maybe a source

of business these guys don't keep fish here that's

first thing is they tear off at dry fibrous husk

terrifying looking then we move inside where these

machete watch this such incredible position 
definitely not something I want to try the

coconut water inside does not get wasted they do 
save it for another use the meat then goes to the

next room where the brown skin is simply peeled 
off break it down into more manageable pieces and

just like that the coconut meat is ready to head 
to the factory so the coconut meat that you saw

being processed in there they're gonna get turned 
into coconut milk the high-tech way but I'm gonna

show you how it's done the low-tech way this is 
still what many many homes use this is what I

used to do when growing up and it's by using this 
cool little contraption here that we actually call

the rabbit or we call this got pie I don't know 
why it's called the rabbit it doesn't look like

a rabbit but I suppose it's close enough now if 
you notice there's really really sharp serrated

blade right here you don't want to touch that 
that's what's going to grate the coconut so first

you got to get it open in half and it's really 
quite simple you just grate it like that seems

easy right and just a few a little bit you get

just full of coconut milk and that's it it's as

you end up with beautiful coconut flesh and all

milk old school but now let me show you how the

here so I'm standing the campus of Thai coconut 
and Thai coconut is a company that manufactures

all sorts of coconut products coconut milk coconut 
beverages like young coconut water coconut snacks

I mean all sorts of things they have their own 
brand but they also make for other brands that

you might have even used they've been so kind 
as to let us in here so we can find out how your

coconut milk gets made so let's take a look first 
order of business we get properly dressed and we

wash our hands once the coconut meat arrives from 
the processing center these ladies with sharp eyes

sort them out and remove any pieces that are too 
young for milking then they get washed with soft

uncoordinated water so they're sparkly clean and 
then it's all big machinery from here the coca

gets blanched in hot water which makes them softer 
and easier to shred then they get shredded into

bits they add some water and then simply squeeze 
the milk out of it and then fresh coconut milk

is strained out I know you can't see much through 
all these machines but that's a good thing trust

me because you know that outside contaminants 
are not gonna get in gotta say it was so hot in

the milking room I was pretty excited to move on 
to the next part so now the coconut milk can take

a few different paths if it's going into canning 
depending on the brand its destined to become it

might need to have some extra ingredients added 
according to the recipe then it gets homogenized

by pressure to prevent fat separation it then goes 
into the cans the cans gets sealed and then they

go into these tunnels where they get heat treated 
to make them shelf stable now for UHT processing

the coconut milk gets heated by traveling through 
these intricate heating tubes at the super fast

rate of six thousand litres an hour so this 
is the control room where they control the

temperature and the tiny UHT processing so UHT 
that just means the paper carton of coconut milk

when you see I use now the thing about UHT is it 
needs to be heated at an ultra high temperature

for a short time and this is where they control 
that time and temperature and that is why it has

a fresher flavor than canned coconut milk because 
it's a higher amount of heat but a shorter amount

of time so I am now in their quality control labs 
now in this lab one of the things that they do

is they check for the amount of solids and the 
amount of solids it's indicative of the amount

of fat present in the coconut basically like 
is it too diluted so she's just dropped some

coconut milk into this machine here and then it 
spits out her reading we're at the end of the

journey here these pans have just gone through the 
heating process and they're sitting down cooling

old-school with big fans and they're also waiting 
the result of quality control to make sure that

the whole heating process and everything feeling 
and everything works as planned wow what a day
